summary: While I know Arya telling Sansa to ‘stick em with the pointy end’ was likely meant as a throwback, I really hope it was a...
body: While I know Arya telling Sansa to ‘stick em with the pointy end’ was likely meant as a throwback, I really hope it was a foreshadow as well and that Sansa is the one to take out Cersei following her sisters advice.

tags: wow I prob sound like a got snob but this is just my experience
summary: Something I’ve noticed is that anytime I talk to someone who has only really watched the show once all the way through, they...
body:
Something I’ve noticed is that anytime I talk to someone who has only really watched the show once all the way through, they didn’t think of political!Jon or Jonsa or Sansa Stark being awesome and the true queen. Honestly, it’s super rare for me to find a casual GOT fan who likes Sansa. 

But I think upon a rewatch things become SO MUCH MORE CLEAR. This show has so many layers and moving parts, and when you’re in it you can’t see it clearly. Hindsight is 20/20. 

Mic drop.

Sansa is my queen.  Walt-era Princess Defense Squad. ISFP, intrapersonal. Wabisabi. OC blog: aninvinciblemagic. Mod Margueritte for otgw-net.

question: asoiaf vs got
answer:
I’m answering this at an awkward time. Or rather, this is an awkward time to answer. Let me explain.

I would have to go with books. The show misses so much- character development, important arcs, diminish/depict badly/entirely cut characters and storylines the showrunners dislike or find boring in favor of ones they do, far too much stuff not in the books meant as cheap shock value. The books maintain a theme of hope in bleak settings that the show sharply misses (the last book is called A Dream of Spring for a reason). They don’t value traditionally feminine protagonists who don’t rely on violence or seduction to get ahead and aren’t much kinder to the male ones. Sansa was grossly punished and portrayed as a stupid, ungrateful teenage girl for wanting perfectly fine things (marry a prince, enjoys fairy tales, likes warm weather and pleasant people over her grey home with siblings who laugh at her). Cat was sidelines hard as a hysterical woman whose political shrewdness was given to her inexperienced teenage son for no reason other than they don’t think moms or middle aged women are important. Don’t get me started on Arya.

But right now… I’m extremely pleased with Sansa. I’m serious, I can’t complain. She stands strong as the daughter of the mad king with dragons wants the North, that Sansa was abused for. She works hard to earn her people’s respect. She eats with them before the battle, as one of them, like Ned did. She gets pretty good lines. She’s finally allowed to be right. I’m sorry it took d&d botching her much better literary arc and breaking her of her ideals and faith, but it’s still enjoyable to see her thrive when much of the fandom has at best wanted her to meekly sit in the corner to let others decide her realm’s fate and at worst hoped she’d die, because she doesn’t exist to prop up their favorites.

blog.name: kogetara
blog.title: into the void
blog.description: where my thoughts are born and die

body:
Sansa S8E03

You don’t have to be a soldier or always on the front lines to be brave.

I really like how they showed a different sort of strength using Sansa. I really like that she’s smart and humble enough to know when to act and when not to. I forget the exact quote she said to Tyrion, but basically she had a great point.

Going down to the crypts is an admission that she doesn’t have the skills to face a battle as a soldier. But keeping the absolute fear off her face with everyone’s eyes on her as she entered the crypts, to not freak them out further - now that’s brave and within her talents. Her arc shows she was trained in political arts (incl. having a poker face) and so she rightfully sits this one out.

But then when the wights arose in the crypts, it’s inescapable. She gathers her courage was going to go after them with Tyrion. Doing what’s right and needed at the right time even when she really didn’t stand a chance.

summary: I stan Petyr, but I don't ship him with anyone. I just tend to enjoy villain characters over good ones and make no apologies...
question: I stan Petyr, but I don't ship him with anyone. I just tend to enjoy villain characters over good ones and make no apologies about it. I find the dark side of humanity fascinating, and Petyr is a well-written villain with a brilliant, diabolical mind. But I understand if you and other's hate him. He should be hated and his actions against Sansa and other women, especially young women scorned. I just tend to enjoy villain characters myself. But I hate apologists with them.
answer:
I stan villains too so the whole purity accusation doesn’t make sense. They’re acting like we’re telling them they can’t like him or read AFFC/the other books for him mostly because they have no real argument to counter what we’re saying. This isn’t like say Stannis/Sansa which I dislike, Littlefinger actually sexually abused Sansa. They literally victim blame Sansa and engage in paedophilia apologism that people use against real human beings. Not only that they find the actual sexual abuse titillating and they call people triggered by their content ‘prudes’ admitting that they find the paedophilia kinky instead of an actual sexual crime. They can’t hide behind ‘we age her up’ because Sansa in the books is a 13 year old, on the show she’s 15/16 and they use what happened to her as ship fodder. It’s like shipping Dolores Haze with Humbert, it’s fucked up. On top of that they have a deep hatred for Sansa that anyone can see.

there is a difference between enjoying the relationship of sansa learning everything about LF so she can later destroy him and enjoy her development through this - but i dont get why people want it to be romantic or sexual. Aidens daughter is the same age as sansa and hes said how this creeped him out

Exactly.

wtf is wrong with these little finger stans lmao? is this the hill y’all wanna die on? defending some fictional pedophile? go back to your corner and stan him quietly. i’m honestly shocked i didn’t know there were lots of sansa x petyr shippers??? just when i thought this fandom couldn’t get any trashier

I was shocked when I realised they existed but thankfully many have deleted their blogs

summary:
People of tumblr I have a question.
The "For the Throne" Album is inspired by the series, but in general or just this season?...
body:
People of tumblr I have a question.

The “For the Throne” Album is inspired by the series, but in general or just this season? And I guess the artists were told a premise or maybe a character and they did their own thing with it, no?

Can someone explain pretty please?

summary: God, I'm tired. I tried asking someone who posted an anti-Sansa post in the Sansa Stark tag to tag it as anti-Sansa. The reply?...
body: God, I’m tired. I tried asking someone who posted an anti-Sansa post in the Sansa Stark tag to tag it as anti-Sansa. The reply? “I’m not anti-Sansa, I just…”. This happens every time. Idk why I try with them. At least people who post anti-daenerys stuff tag correctly.

blog.name: direwolfdressandcloak
blog.title: Finally showing my love for Jon/Sansa openly

tags: but considering that most people saying this
summary: I can't believe that people are still trying to call Sansa useless or cowardly for going to the crypts. When in fact what she...
body:
I can’t believe that people are still trying to call Sansa useless or cowardly for going to the crypts. When in fact what she was being was unselfish and smart.

Noncombatants being on the battlefield is cute, and all ‘go warrior! You’re so brave!’…. up until the point that you realize that the actual combatants are therefore going to have to ignore their own safety to protect these noncombatants. Especially if these noncombatants are Important People, and the combatants have a duty to see them safe.

The reason that Jorah got killed? Was because Dany, a noncombatant without her dragon, was on the battlefield. Full stop. He literally took the blow that killed him by being in front of her. Had she not been there, his chances of surviving would have exponentially increased. Now obviously she didn’t fall off her dragon on purpose. But still. The point remains.

Sansa realized that she would be putting people in danger if she stayed on the battlefield, and so she put her selfish wishes to be there for her people aside and went down to a place where she thought she would be safer and no one would have to defend her.

And when it became necessary, she was even ready to defend herself, if need be.

So just leave her alone, she’s been through enough.

summary: Can I say, I just love the fact that the show did not force the fact that certain characters are just not “fighters” in the...
body:
Can I say, I just love the fact that the show did not force the fact that certain characters are just not “fighters” in the physical sense, especially when it comes to certain female characters. I’ve seen sansa gotten alot of shit before because she wasn’t a fighter like arya. She has no interest in swords and I just like that one thing this shows highlights strength can be many ways, doesn’t always mean you have to know how to use a weapon. The most dangerous women and men did not wield a weapon. 

Sansa was willing to stand there with everyone regardless or not knowing how to fight because she was planning to be with her people to the end. She only left to not be a hindrance to her sister. I just think that is just as baddass in my opinion. Many of the women in this show may not be warrior in the literal sense but they all made their strength known - Lady mormont, Sansa, Danny, Gilly, Messandei. Even that little girl who had the guts to die for her people. I just love that strength is highlighted to be more than physical. The strength of will and courage is the most admirable of all regardless of skill set.

summary: It can't just be me that gets annoyed when Game of Thrones fans of like 3 years start piping up about who they hate and which...
body: It can’t just be me that gets annoyed when Game of Thrones fans of like 3 years start piping up about who they hate and which character is the worst (usually Sansa, Theon, Dany, etc). I’m like bitch I’ve been reading/watching this for literal YEARS and you will not tell ME how it goes.

reblog.comment: It can’t just be me that gets annoyed when Game of Thrones fans of like 3 years start piping up about who they hate and which character is the worst (usually Sansa, Theon, Dany, etc). I’m like bitch I’ve been reading/watching this for literal YEARS and you will not tell ME how it goes.

I’m like bitch I’ve been reading/watching this for literal YEARS and you will not tell ME how it goes.

I’m like bitch I’ve been reading/watching this for literal YEARS and you will not tell ME how it goes.
